definition: usually/in many cases/more often than not
to go (in a direction)/to/towards/(of a train) bound for/past/previous
to go (in a direction)/to/towards/(of a train) bound for/past/previous

sentences.english: There are many cases of human rights violations filed before the police.
sentences.chinese: 警方接手许多人权侵犯案件，往往牵连到高级官员。

sentences.english: Gold section head of gold, the owner often high in cost.
sentences.chinese: 黄金地段黄金市口，业主往往要价很高。

sentences.english: During the construction of socialistic new villages, people always confuse religion with feudal superstition.
sentences.chinese: 在农村中，人们往往把宗教与封建迷信联系在一起。

sentences.english: The history of superstitious pratices can often help to explain them.
sentences.chinese: 迷信风俗的历史往往可以用来解释它本身。

sentences.english: Some teachers tend to spoon-feed their students.
sentences.chinese: 有些教师往往填鸭式地教育他们的学生。

sentences.english: Churches are now too often destructive battlegrounds of an ideological right and left.
sentences.chinese: 而今教堂往往成为意识形态左右派相斗的消极战场。
临床上往往伴发急性膀胱炎。

sentences.english: However, aerogels tend to be extremely fragile.
sentences.chinese: 然而，气凝胶往往非常易碎。

sentences.english: These are complex and diverse phenomena, but their influences on pregnant women are often underestimated.
sentences.chinese: 然而，这个现象对孕妇的影响却往往被轻估。

sentences.english: When guests enter Miao people's village, they often meet road-block drinks.
sentences.chinese: 客人进苗寨时，往往遇到拦路酒。

sentences.english: And as we all know, change is often slow and incremental.
sentences.chinese: 正如我们所知，变革往往是缓慢和渐进的。

sentences.english: The philistine is often a snob.
For unknown reasons, people with alcoholic liver disease often have hepatitis C as well.
sentences.chinese: 不知什么原因，人们往往与酒精性肝病和丙型肝炎。
生病的植物往往是退绿的。

sentences.english: This delay is often a frustrating factor in cell-network data connections.
sentences.chinese: 延迟往往是蜂窝式网络中最令人抓狂的因素。

sentences.english: But in this area, it seems that no good idea goes unpunished.
sentences.chinese: 但是在这个地区，好提议却往往得不到认同。

definition: for the most part/many/most/the greater part/mostly
therefore/as a result/thus/and as a result, ...
